definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly

sentences.english: John is lobbying some members of the legislature.
sentences.chinese: 约翰在对一些立法委员们进行游说。

sentences.english: Lu has served as a lawmaker and a county leader.
sentences.chinese: 吕是一个立法委员和县领导。

sentences.english: Mr. Chambliss often spoke about his efforts as a policy-maker against terrorism .
sentences.chinese: 张伯利斯经常讲述他作为反恐立法委员所做的努力。

sentences.english: Lawmaker urges shark fin trading ban.
sentences.chinese: 中国立法委员呼吁禁止鲨鱼翅交易。

sentences.english: A lawmaker does not have to report the value of his or her house.
sentences.chinese: 立法委员住宅的价值是不需要报告的。

sentences.english: Officials said the advertising would accelerate as the legislators returned home for the summer.
sentences.chinese: 官方表示这些宣传只会促进立法委员回家避暑。

sentences.english: The objectors called on the legislators to defeat the bill.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者吁请立法委员勿通过该法案。

sentences.english: The public angered by what a lady legislator said to close down the Consumers'Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 一位女立法委员说要关闭消费者基金会而引起了公愤。

definition: abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
Legislative Yuan, the legislative branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
Executive Yuan, the executive branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
Judicial Yuan, the high court under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
James Soong (1942-), Taiwanese politician expelled from Guomindang in 2000 when he founded People First Party 親民黨|亲民党
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
